snippet: Researchers at George Washington University found that Islamic State recruits defy a single profile, but the authorities say more are staying home.
abstract: Study conducted by researchers at George Washington University finds suspects arrested in United States on charges of helping Islamic State are diverse and do not adhere to any single profile, but are generally young converts to Islam; study also reflects increasing role of women in organization; authorities have apprehended 56 suspects in 2015, highest number in any year since 2001.
lead_paragraph: Researchers at George Washington University found that Islamic State recruits defy a single profile, but the authorities say more are staying home.

headline.main: ISIS Followers in U.S. Are Diverse and Young
headline.print_headline: ISIS Followers in U.S. Are Diverse and Young

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
